intro: Erigeron melanocephalus, commonly known as the black-headed fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its dark purple to black flower heads are distinctive and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Erigeron melanocephalus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
